title: Hands-On AI Projects for the Classroom
driving_question: How can we use AI to solve real-world problems and inspire innovation in various fields?
short_background_context: The International Society for Technology in Education (ISTE) is a nonprofit organization that works with the global education community to accelerate the use of technology to solve tough problems and inspire innovation. ISTE sets a bold vision for education transformation through the ISTE Standards, a framework for students, educators, administrators, coaches and computer science educators to rethink education and create innovative learning environments. This mission will involve hands-on AI projects that will enable students to apply AI in solving problems in various subjects such as Economics, Climate, Statistics, Geometry, History, Health, Ethics, and Algebra.
tasks: Develop an AI Chatbot that can answer questions on a specific subject
Critically analyze the use of AI in various fields and discuss its ethical implications
Design an AI project that can solve a real-world problem in one of the subjects
pre_thinking_prompts: What do you know about AI?
How do you think AI can be applied in the subjects you are studying?
What are some of the ethical considerations when using AI?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on your experience designing and implementing an AI project. What did you learn? What challenges did you face and how did you overcome them?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain how your AI Chatbot works?
What are some potential ethical issues with your AI project?
How does your AI project contribute to innovation in the subject area?
remix_zone: Students can remix the problem by choosing a different subject area for their AI project or by developing a different type of AI technology (e.g., machine learning model, recommendation system, etc.)
